title: Print, "Woodcut (facsimile): An embroiderer at work", 1550–1600
medium: Black ink printed on white paper
inscribed: Pritned in black ink, lower half of page: eight-line verse, in German, relating to embroiderer's trade.
provenance: The Estate of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harpor
creditline: Gift of the Estate of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper
description: Embroiderer shown at work in his shop, assisted by a woman. Facsimile of a page from early 16th century book.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Woodcut (facsimile): An embroiderer at work", 1550–1600.
1550–1600. Black ink printed on white paper. Gift of the Estate of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper. 1957-166-208.
